### Recent News

- Bulls underwent major trades: Acquired Jaden Ivey, Anfernee Simons, Guerschon Yabusele, Collin Sexton; traded Coby White, Nikola Vucevic, Ayo Dosunmu, Kevin Huerter; received nine second-round picks[2].

- Expected Bulls lineup: Sexton, Ivey, Okoro, Buzelis, Miller[2].

### Additional Context
### Jamal Murray Injury Status
Jamal Murray exited Denver's 136-120 win at Chicago on Saturday (February 7, 2026) with 4:05 left in the fourth quarter due to a **left hip issue** (also described as apparent leg/lower body injury)[1][2][3][5][6]. He played 31 minutes, scoring 28 points (11-18 FG, 4-9 3PT), 3 rebounds, and 11 assists[1][2][3]. Head coach David Adelman stated post-game he is "confident [Murray] will be okay" after further evaluation (reported February 7-8, 2026)[1][2]. No specific severity or return timeline confirmed; he is considered questionable for next game vs. Cavaliers (Monday, February 9)[2]. This matters as Murray averages 25+ points, 4+ rebounds, 7.5 assists on career-best efficiency (48.6% FG, 43.2% 3PT) in 47 games, forming Denver's core offense with Jokic; any absence amplifies losses of Aaron Gordon (hamstring, re-eval 4-6 weeks from Jan 29) and Peyton Watson (Grade 2 hamstring, out at least 4 weeks from Feb 6)[1][3][4].

### Nikola Jokic Status
No injury concerns for **Nikola Jokic**; he played and made history with a triple-double in Saturday's win vs. Bulls (specific stats not detailed in reports)[3]. Jokic is Denver's anchor, complementing Murray as the team's top player; his availability is not in question, preserving half of Denver's offensive engine[1].

### Betting Lines and Sharp Money Movement
Search results contain **no current betting lines**, odds, or sharp money movement data for Nuggets @ Bulls[1][2][3][4][5][6]. No evidence market has priced in Murray's injury (news from Feb 7-8 game); absence of line info prevents assessing roster impact mismatch.

### Game Context and Roster Impact
Denver won Saturday's game 136-120 despite Murray's exit (up 15 points at departure), ending a three-game skid, but faces injury-plagued roster with Gordon and Watson out long-term[1][2][3][4][5]. Two home games remain before All-Star break (vs. Cavaliers Monday, Grizzlies Wednesday), offering recovery window if Murray misses time[1][3]. Murray/Jokic duo critical: Murray's health vital amid Jokic's prior knee absence and team's championship reliance on star backcourt[1].
